intro: Sphaeradenia danielii, commonly known as Daniel's star-spleenwort, is a rare and specialized fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, creeping growth habit and small, clustered fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant produces sporangia in specialized structures called sorangia, which are clustered on the underside of the fronds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rock surfaces or in crevices. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Sphaeradenia danielii is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
